item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban break up women's rights protest in Kabul
item.description: The women say the Taliban used tear gas and pepper spray to disperse the latest such protest.

item.title: Afghanistan: Former vice-president tells BBC he's in Panjshir Valley
item.description: Amrullah Saleh, in the Panjshir Valley, tells the BBC that fighters face a "difficult" situation.

item.title: Ethiopia: Thousands of Tigray rebels killed, military claims
item.description: A leading general says 5,600 rebels have been killed in fierce fighting aided by airstrikes.

item.title: New Zealand supermarket stabbing: Government to toughen anti-terror laws
item.description: The Auckland attacker has now been identified as Sri Lankan Ahamed Aathil Mohamed Samsudeen.

item.title: Ivermectin: Oklahoma doctor warns against using unproven Covid drug
item.description: People are arriving at US hospitals after overdosing in the unproven belief it can treat Covid.

item.title: Tuna bounce back, but sharks in 'desperate' decline
item.description: Extinction list update reveals mixed news for marine life, as world conservation summit open in France.

item.title: New Zealand cinema worker left red-faced after voicemail blooper
item.description: A cinema employee in New Zealand went viral on TikTok with his attempt to leave a voicemail recording.

item.title: The ATMs that dispense green fuel
item.description: How a start-up in Kenya is changing the way people cook.

item.title: US Open: Naomi Osaka's title defence ended by teenager Leylah Fernandez
item.description: Naomi Osaka's US Open title defence is over as she falls in the third round to a stunning performance by Canadian teenager Leylah Fernandez.

item.title: Capitol riot: 'QAnon Shaman' pleads guilty in federal court
item.description: Jacob Chansley had been indicted on six counts for his role in the pro-Trump siege at the US Capitol.

item.title: Poor US jobs growth shows Covid Delta variant impact
item.description: The US economy added just 235,000 jobs in August, according to the Bureau of Labour Statistics.

item.title: Bitcoin: El Salvador divided over legal tender law
item.description: The country will be the first to recognise the crypto-currency as legal tender from September 7.

item.title: Beijing 2022: China readies for Winter Olympics as pressure grows
item.description: The upcoming Games are already proving controversial with calls for a boycott growing.

item.title: Why has Australia switched tack on Covid zero?
item.description: Australia is racing to vaccinate its population ahead of a huge shift in its pandemic strategy.

item.title: Why China's bitcoin miners are moving to Texas
item.description: Beijing's crackdown on cryptocurrency sends bitcoin entrepreneurs moving to the wild wild west.

item.title: Sahel jihadists: West Africa faces up to policing its terror triangle
item.description: New tactics are being used in the fight against jihadists as Chad and France reduce their military roles.

item.title: German election: Who could succeed Angela Merkel as chancellor?
item.description: A lacklustre lead candidate and a surprisingly strong Social Democrat have blown the race wide open.

item.title: Covid: What Israel tells us about the way out of the pandemic
item.description: Third jabs given as part of a booster programme are beginning to dampen the latest Covid surge.

item.title: British soldier describes caring for Kabul airport baby
item.description: Lt Col Ben Caesar helped look after the baby who was pulled over the airport wall in Afghanistan.

item.title: 'My parents won't let me get the Covid vaccine'
item.description: In some countries, the Covid-19 vaccine can be given to all teenagers over the age of 12 but not all are allowed.

item.title: ICYMI: Catwalk hail storm and cheeky capybaras
item.description: Some of the stories that you may have missed this week.

item.title: Afghanistan: British Army officers tell of 'chaotic' evacuation operation
item.description: The senior British commander in Kabul speaks for the first time about the UK's evacuation operation.

item.title: Storm Ida aftermath: 'I can't even count my losses from the flooding right now'
item.description: Residents in the US north-east assess the scale of the devastation caused by Tropical Storm Ida.

item.title: Life under the Taliban: Where is your male escort?
item.description: Lyse Doucet takes the temperature on the streets of the Afghan capital as the Taliban tighten their grip.

item.title: Afghanistan: What rise of Taliban means for Pakistan
item.description: Some Western powers hope that Pakistan could play a role as a mediator with the new Taliban government.

item.title: Kabul drone strike: The key questions about a US attack
item.description: Ten Afghan civilians died when the US targeted a vehicle it says was linked to an imminent bombing.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban says it will 'raise voice for Kashmir Muslims'
item.description: A spokesman for the group tells the BBC it plans to support Muslims in Indian-administered Kashmir.
